content.description: Sit start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand edge in the crack. From there, climb up through bumps and edge to reach the peak, then acheive the slab, and follow it arete for an easy finish.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's north face.

content.description: Sit start from a pair of edges/pockets. From there, climb up and left through edges to a left hand two-finger pocket, follow to the arete, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the east face of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched on the block jug. From there, gain a left hand undercling/sidepull, follow to peak, and wrap around to finish the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has a rock behind it.
content.location: It climbs the west side of the southwest arete.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull on the arete and a sloper/sidepull right hand. The key here is situating the feet, pull up with a right heel to the arete, then follow it to the two-finger pocket, and continue up to mantel on the boulder.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good, but a bush lies behind it.
content.location: It climbs the east side of the boulder's southeast arete.
